sections.heading: ESI Registration
content: Businesses in India must register for Employees' State Insurance (ESI) under the Employees' State Insurance Act, 1948. This program helps workers and their families by paying for medical care, sick leave, maternity leave, disability coverage, and money in case of death on the job.
Companies that meet certain requirements must sign up with the Employees' State Insurance Corporation (ESIC) and make monthly payments to the fund.

sections.heading: Who Needs to Sign Up for ESI?

points: Companies that have 10 or more employees (20 in some states)
Employees who make ₹21,000 or less a month
All kinds of businesses, such as companies, LLPs, partnerships, and sole proprietorships
Once your business is covered by ESI, it stays covered even if you hire fewer people than the minimum

sections.heading: What ESI Can Do For You

list.title: For Workers
points: Free medical care for employees and their families
Financial help for dependents if an employee dies

list.title: For Employers
points: Lowers the cost of medical care

sections.heading: Documents Needed to Register for ESI

list.title: Documents for the Owner or Director
points: An email address and phone number

sections.heading: How to Sign Up for ESI

points: Use your PAN to make an employer account on the ESIC portal
Give information about your business, who owns it, and who works there
The ESIC looks over your application and gives you a 17-digit ESI Registration Number
It usually takes 7 to 15 business days to finish
Pay your ESI contributions every month by the 15th of the next month
File your ESI returns twice a year
Keep accurate records of attendance and wages

sections.heading: Penalties for Not Following the Rules

points: Loss of benefits for your workers
Do new businesses need to register with ESI? Yes, as long as you have the right number of employees and they are paid less than the limit.
Is it possible for me to sign up for ESI on my own? Yes, but only if you meet the coverage requirements in some cases.
Do contract workers get ESI? Yes, both temporary and contract workers are covered.
What happens if an employee makes more than ₹21,000? Employees who make more than ₹21,000 are usually not covered, unless they signed up before their pay went up.
Can workers choose not to join ESI? No, once ESI coverage is required, it is.
What happens if the number of employees I have goes down? Even if your workforce drops below the threshold, ESI coverage stays in place.
